sentence.Network_en: It is best to coppice the trees in the winter before the sap rises.
sentence.Network_cn: 最好在冬天树汁增多之前修剪这些树。

sentence.Network_en: A thicket of small trees or shrubs ; a coppice.
sentence.Network_cn: 第二天,在一个美丽的小 灌木 林里布置了野餐.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French copeiz, based on medieval Latin colpus 'a blow' (see cope). Compare with copse

entry.def: A coppice is a small group of trees growing very close to each other.

example.ex: ...the mixed coppice is an ideal habitat for nesting birds.
example.tran: 长有各种树木的矮树林是巢居鸟的理想栖息地。

entry.tran: 修剪(使更美观或为获得木材)
entry.def: To coppice trees or bushes means to cut off parts of them, in order to make them look more attractive or to make it easier to obtain wood from them.

example.ex: It is best to coppice the trees in the winter before the sap rises.
example.tran: 最好在冬天树汁增多之前修剪这些树。

example.ex: ...extensive oak woods with coppiced hazel and sweet chestnut.
example.tran: 其中长有修剪过的榛树和板栗树的一大片橡树林

auth_sentence.content: Hereby, upon the edge of yonder coppice.
auth_sentence.res_content: Hereby, upon the edge of yonder coppice.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Hereby, upon the edge of yonder coppice.
